page.title: 18ROYAL CONNECTIONS
page.content: {STOKE CLIMSLAND}LAYS CLAIM TO ROYAL VISITORS OVER THE CENTURIES. THERE IS {NO HISTORICAL EVIDENCE}FOR EITHER THE {BLACK PRINCE OR CHARLES I}VISITING THE PARISH THOUGH IT IS POSSBLE THAT THEY PASSED THROUGH IN THEIR TIME.WHAT IS OF NO DISPUTE IS THAT THE{HOUSE OF {WINDSOR}HAVE MADE MANY AND FREQUENT VISITS TO THE AREA. THIS MAINLY DUE TO A{FORMER RECTOR, CANNON L.M. ANDREWS, WHO WAS{CHAPLAIN TO THE DUKE OF {WINDSOR, LATER KING EDWARD VIII. KING {GEORGE VI}FOLLOWED IN HIS BROTHER'S FOOTSTEPS AND WITH{HIS QUEEN}VISITED THE{DUCHY HOME FARM}ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS. OUR PRESENT{QUEEN}VISITED AS{PRINCESS ELIZABETH}AND AGAIN WITH {THE DUKE OF EDINBURGH}ON HER FIRST OFFICIAL VISIT IN{1956. PRINCE CHARLES HAS BEEN A FREQUENT VISITOR TO THE AREA TAKING GREAT INTEREST IN THE RUNNING OF THE{DUCHY HOME FARM.
